actions.name: updatePaymentLink
actions.label: Update a Payment Link

spec.help:
`Redirect`: Redirects the customer to the specified url after the purchase is complete.

`Hosted Confirmation`: Displays a message on the hosted surface after the purchase is complete.
spec.name: type
spec.label: Type

spec.help: The URL the customer will be redirected to after the purchase is complete. You can embed `{CHECKOUT_SESSION_ID}` into the URL to have the id of the completed checkout session included.
spec.name: url
spec.label: URL

spec.help: If `true`, tax will be calculated automatically using the customer’s location.
spec.name: enabled
spec.label: Enabled

spec.help: Two-letter country codes representing which countries Checkout should provide as options for shipping locations. Unsupported country codes: AS, CX, CC, CU, HM, IR, KP, MH, FM, NF, MP, PW, SD, SY, UM, VI.
spec.name: allowed_countries
spec.label: Allowed Countries

actions.description: Updates a payment link by its ID.

actions.name: updatePaymentIntent
actions.label: Update a Payment Intent

store.help: How much to charge in the smallest currency unit (e.g., 100 cents to charge $1.00 or 100 to charge ¥100, a zero-decimal currency). The minimum amount is $0.50 US or equivalent in charge currency.
store.name: amount
store.label: Amount

nested.help: Indicate that the customer is not in your checkout flow during this payment attempt, and therefore is unable to authenticate. This parameter is intended for scenarios where you collect card details and [charge them later](https://stripe.com/docs/payments/cards/charging-saved-cards).
nested.name: off_session
nested.label: Off Session

nested.help: Fail the payment attempt if the Payment Intent transitions into requires_action. This parameter is intended for simpler integrations that do not handle customer actions, like [saving cards without authentication](https://stripe.com/docs/payments/save-card-without-authentication).
nested.name: error_on_requires_action
nested.label: Error On Requires Action

nested.help: The URL to redirect your customer back to after they authenticate or cancel their payment on the payment method’s app or site. If you’d prefer to redirect to a mobile application, you can alternatively supply an application URI scheme.
nested.name: return_url
nested.label: Return URL

store.help: If this is not provided, defaults to [“card”]
store.name: payment_method_types
store.label: Payment Method Types

options.label: Create a Payment Method and attach to this Payment Intent

nested.help: Providing this parameter will [attach the payment method](https://stripe.com/docs/payments/save-during-payment) to the Payment Intent’s Customer, if present, after the Payment Intent is confirmed and any required actions from the user are complete. If no Customer was provided, the payment method can still be [attached](https://stripe.com/docs/api/payment_methods/attach) to a Customer after the transaction completes.
nested.name: setup_future_usage
nested.label: Setup Future Usage

spec.help: Sort code of the bank account. (e.g., 10-20-30)
spec.name: sort_code
spec.label: Sort Code

spec.help: This field is mandatory if `Shipping Address` is supplied.
spec.name: line1
spec.label: Line 1

spec.help: This field is mandatory if `Shipping Address` is supplied.
spec.name: name
spec.label: Recipient Name

store.help: For non-card charges, you can use this value as the complete description that appears on your customers’ statements.
store.name: statement_descriptor
store.label: Statement Descriptor

store.help: Concatenated with the statement descriptor prefix and statement descriptor to form the complete statement descriptor.
store.name: statement_descriptor_suffix
store.label: Statement Descriptor Suffix

spec.help: Installment configuration for payments attempted on this Payment Intent (Mexico Only). For more information, see the [installments integration guide](https://stripe.com/docs/payments/installments).
spec.name: enabled
spec.label: Enabled

spec.help: Only when `confirm` is set to true.
spec.name: network
spec.label: Network

spec.help: Stripe strongly recommend that you rely on our SCA Engine to automatically prompt your customers for authentication based on risk level and [other requirements](https://stripe.com/docs/strong-customer-authentication). However, if you wish to request 3D Secure based on logic from your own fraud engine, provide this option. Read the guide on [manually requesting 3D Secure](https://stripe.com/docs/payments/3d-secure#manual-three-ds) for more information on how this configuration interacts with Radar and the SCA Engine.
spec.name: request_three_d_secure
spec.label: Request 3D Secure

nested.help: *Stripe Connect Only* Only when using iOS or Android SDKs to handle additional authentication steps.
nested.name: use_stripe_sdk
nested.label: Use Stripe SDK

store.help: *Stripe Connect Only* Identifies the resulting payment as part of a group. See the [use case for connected accounts](https://stripe.com/docs/payments/connected-accounts) for details.
store.name: transfer_group
store.label: Transfer Group

store.help: *Stripe Connect Only* For more information, see the Payment Intents [use case for connected accounts](https://stripe.com/docs/payments/connected-accounts).
store.name: application_fee_amount
store.label: Application Fee Amount

store.help: *Stripe Connect Only* For more information, see the Payment Intents [use case for connected accounts](https://stripe.com/docs/payments/connected-accounts).
store.name: on_behalf_of
store.label: On Behalf Of

store.help: *Stripe Connect Only* The parameters used to automatically create a Transfer when the payment succeeds. For more information, see the Payment Intents use case for connected accounts.
store.name: transfer_data

spec.help: The amount that will be transferred automatically when a charge succeeds. The amount is capped at the total transaction amount and if no amount is set, the full amount is transferred.
spec.name: amount
spec.label: Amount

store.label: Transfer Data

spec.help:
`Redirect`: Redirects the customer to the specified url after the purchase is complete.

`Hosted Confirmation`: Displays a message on the hosted surface after the purchase is complete.
spec.name: type
spec.label: Type

spec.help: The URL the customer will be redirected to after the purchase is complete. You can embed `{CHECKOUT_SESSION_ID}` into the URL to have the id of the completed checkout session included.
spec.name: url
spec.label: URL

spec.help: If `true`, tax will be calculated automatically using the customer’s location.
spec.name: enabled
spec.label: Enabled

store.help: Three-letter currency code in lowercase. For example, `usd`. Must be a supported currency and supported by each line item’s price.
store.name: currency
store.label: Currency

spec.help:
`On Session`: If you intend to only reuse the payment method when your customer is present in your checkout flow.

`Off Session`: If your customer may or may not be present in your checkout flow.
spec.name: setup_future_usage
spec.label: Setup Future Usage

spec.help: Two-letter country codes representing which countries Checkout should provide as options for shipping locations. Unsupported country codes: AS, CX, CC, CU, HM, IR, KP, MH, FM, NF, MP, PW, SD, SY, UM, VI.
spec.name: allowed_countries
spec.label: Allowed Countries

store.help: __[Stripe Connect Only]__ The amount of the application fee (if any) that will be requested to be applied to the payment and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. Can only be applied when there are no line items with recurring prices.
store.name: application_fee_amount
store.label: Application Fee Amount

store.help: __[Stripe Connect Only]__ This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the application owner’s Stripe account. There must be at least 1 line item with a recurring price to use this field.
store.name: application_fee_percent
store.label: Application Fee Percent

store.help: __[Stripe Connect Only]__ The account on behalf of which to charge.
store.name: on_behalf_of
store.label: On Behalf Of

spec.help: __[Stripe Connect Only]__ If specified, successful charges will be attributed to the destination account for tax reporting, and the funds from charges will be transferred to the destination account.
spec.name: destination
spec.label: Destination

spec.help: __[Stripe Connect Only]__ The amount that will be transferred automatically when a charge succeeds.
spec.name: amount
spec.label: Amount

`Exclude` will always create an empty invoice draft regardless if there are pending invoice items or not.

`Include` will include any pending invoice items, and will create an empty draft invoice if no pending invoice items exist.

Defaults to `Exclude` if the parameter is omitted.

store.label: Currency

store.help: Whether or not to immediately capture the charge. When false, the charge issues an authorization (or pre-authorization), and will need to be [captured](https://stripe.com/docs/api#capture_charge) later. Uncaptured charges expire in **7 days**. For more information, see [authorizing charges and settling later](https://support.stripe.com/questions/can-i-authorize-a-charge-and-then-wait-to-settle-it-later).
store.name: capture
store.label: Capture

store.help: An arbitrary string which you can attach to a charge object. It is displayed when in the web interface alongside the charge. Note that if you use Stripe to send automatic email receipts to your customers, your receipt emails will include the description of the charge(s) that they are describing.
store.name: description
store.label: Description

store.help: The ID of an existing customer that will be charged in this request.
store.name: customer
store.label: Customer

store.help: A payment source to be charged, such as a credit card. If you also pass a customer ID, the source must be the ID of a source belonging to the customer. Otherwise, if you do not pass a customer ID, the source you provide must either be a token, like the ones returned by [Stripe.js](https://stripe.com/docs/stripe.js). For security reasons, Make doesn't support charging with user's credit card details.
store.name: source
store.label: Source

actions.description: Creates a charge.

actions.name: confirmPaymentIntent
actions.label: Confirm a Payment Intent

options.label: Create a Payment Method and attach to this Payment Intent

nested.help: Providing this parameter will [attach the payment method](https://stripe.com/docs/payments/save-during-payment) to the Payment Intent’s Customer, if present, after the Payment Intent is confirmed and any required actions from the user are complete. If no Customer was provided, the payment method can still be [attached](https://stripe.com/docs/api/payment_methods/attach) to a Customer after the transaction completes.
nested.name: setup_future_usage
nested.label: Setup Future Usage

spec.help: Sort code of the bank account. (e.g., 10-20-30)
spec.name: sort_code
spec.label: Sort Code

spec.help: This field is mandatory if `Shipping Address` is supplied.
spec.name: line1
spec.label: Line 1

spec.help: This field is mandatory if `Shipping Address` is supplied.
spec.name: name
spec.label: Recipient Name

store.help: If this is not provided, defaults to [“card”]
store.name: payment_method_types
store.label: Payment Method Types

spec.help: Installment configuration for payments attempted on this Payment Intent (Mexico Only). For more information, see the [installments integration guide](https://stripe.com/docs/payments/installments).
spec.name: enabled
spec.label: Enabled

nested.help: Number of installment payments your customer will make to their credit card.
nested.name: count
nested.label: Count

spec.help: Only when `confirm` is set to true.
spec.name: network
spec.label: Network

spec.help: Stripe strongly recommend that you rely on our SCA Engine to automatically prompt your customers for authentication based on risk level and [other requirements](https://stripe.com/docs/strong-customer-authentication). However, if you wish to request 3D Secure based on logic from your own fraud engine, provide this option. Read the guide on [manually requesting 3D Secure](https://stripe.com/docs/payments/3d-secure#manual-three-ds) for more information on how this configuration interacts with Radar and the SCA Engine.
spec.name: request_three_d_secure
spec.label: Request 3D Secure

store.help: Indicate that the customer is not in your checkout flow during this payment attempt, and therefore is unable to authenticate. This parameter is intended for scenarios where you collect card details and [charge them later](https://stripe.com/docs/payments/cards/charging-saved-cards).
store.name: off_session
store.label: Off Session

store.help: Fail the payment attempt if the Payment Intent transitions into requires_action. This parameter is intended for simpler integrations that do not handle customer actions, like [saving cards without authentication](https://stripe.com/docs/payments/save-card-without-authentication).
store.name: error_on_requires_action
store.label: Error On Requires Action

store.help: The URL to redirect your customer back to after they authenticate or cancel their payment on the payment method’s app or site. If you’d prefer to redirect to a mobile application, you can alternatively supply an application URI scheme.
store.name: return_url
store.label: Return URL

actions.description: Confirms a payment intent by its ID. Upon confirmation, the payment intent will attempt to initiate a payment.

actions.name: capturePaymentIntent
actions.label: Capture a Payment Intent

store.help: The amount to capture from the Payment Intent, which must be less than or equal to the original amount. Any additional amount will be automatically refunded. Defaults to the full `amount_capturable` if not provided.
store.name: amount_to_capture
store.label: Amount to Capture

store.help: For non-card charges, you can use this value as the complete description that appears on your customers’ statements.
store.name: statement_descriptor
store.label: Statement Descriptor

store.help: Concatenated with the statement descriptor prefix and statement descriptor to form the complete statement descriptor.
store.name: statement_descriptor_suffix
store.label: Statement Descriptor Suffix

store.help: *Stripe Connect Only* For more information, see the Payment Intents [use case for connected accounts](https://stripe.com/docs/payments/connected-accounts).
store.name: application_fee_amount
store.label: Application Fee Amount

store.help: *Stripe Connect Only* The parameters used to automatically create a Transfer when the payment succeeds. For more information, see the Payment Intents use case for connected accounts.
store.name: transfer_data

spec.help: The amount that will be transferred automatically when a charge succeeds. The amount is capped at the total transaction amount and if no amount is set, the full amount is transferred.
spec.name: amount
spec.label: Amount

store.label: Transfer Data

actions.description: Captures an existing uncaptured payment intent by its ID.

actions.name: CaptureCharge
actions.label: Capture a Charge

store.help: The identifier of the charge to be captured.
store.name: charge
store.label: Charge to capture

store.help: A positive integer in the [smallest currency unit](https://support.stripe.com/questions/which-zero-decimal-currencies-does-stripe-support) (e.g., 100 cents to charge $1.00 or 100 to charge ¥100, a 0-decimal currency) representing how much to capture. The amount to capture, which must be less than or equal to the original amount. Any additional amount will be automatically refunded.
store.name: amount
store.label: Amount

store.help: An application fee to add on to this charge. Can only be used with Stripe Connect.
store.name: application_fee
store.label: Application fee

store.help: A dictionary containing a new destination amount to use. Can only be used with destination charges created with Stripe Connect.
store.name: destination

spec.help: The portion of this charge to send to the destination account.
spec.name: amount
spec.label: Amount

store.label: Destination

store.help: This will override the previously-specified email address for this charge, if one was set.
store.name: receipt_email
store.label: Receipt email

actions.description: Capture the payment of an existing, uncaptured, charge.

actions.name: cancelPayout
actions.label: Cancel a Payout

store.help: The identifier of the payout to be cancelled.
store.name: payout
store.label: Payout

actions.description: Cancels a previously created payout.

actions.name: cancelPaymentIntent
actions.label: Cancel a Payment Intent
actions.description: Cancels a payment intent by its ID. For payment intents with status ’requires_capture’, the remaining capturable amount will automatically be refunded.

actions.name: makeAnApiCall
actions.label: Make an API Call

store.help: Enter a path relative to `https://api.stripe.com/`.
store.name: url
store.label: URL

store.help: You don't have to add authorization headers; we already did that for you.
store.name: headers
store.label: Headers

actions.description: Performs an arbitrary authorized API call.
